title: Statement by the Press Secretary on S. 2195 | whitehouse.gov
content:
The White House
Office of the Press Secretary


For Immediate Release
April 18, 2014

 



Statement by the Press Secretary on S. 2195




On Friday, April 18, 2014, the President signed into law:
S. 2195, which amends current law to deny admission to the United States to any representative to the United Nations who the President determines has been engaged in terrorist activity against the United States or its allies and may pose a threat toÂ U.S. national security interests.
